kernfrasen: God has adopted him as his heir
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: GOD IS FATHER AND BELIEVERS ARE CHILDREN

kernfrasen: no fortune, vast or otherwise, in my future
laid up his treasure somewhere else

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: God has adopted him as his heir

cognitieve_implicaties: The believer has a secure future regardless of current effort
theologische_implicaties: The Holy Spirit acts as a legal guarantor
ethische_implicaties: Freedom to take risks because the 'capital' is safe

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher revitalizes the dead metaphor of 'heir' by grounding it in 1970s economic anxieties (inflation, stock market, private hospital rooms).

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher maintains a tight mapping between the legal/economic reality of an inheritance and the spiritual reality of the Gospel throughout the entire text.

incoherentie_punten.conflict_beschrijving: Brief shift from receiving a legacy to building a foundation.
incoherentie_punten.entailment_conflict: One implies gift, the other implies effort.

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: Redefining the 'assets' of the inheritance to include the 'liabilities' of Christ's suffering.

sterktes.beschrijving: Uses concrete 1970s social markers (Princeton, Mallorca, La Crémallière) to make the abstract concept of 'inheritance' tangible.
sterktes.voorbeeld: He knows he can send his children to Princeton... he will not have to go without a vacation.

risicos.beschrijving: By using high-society wealth as the source domain, there is a risk of equating God's favor with material prosperity.
risicos.voorbeeld: The person who knows he has an inheritance has reason to be less anxious.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Congregation might view faith as a spiritual insurance policy for their lifestyle.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: A 1975 Greenwich, CT upper-class social setting.
sub_worlds: The world of the American Bicentennial
The world of the suffering global church (South Africa/Korea)

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: High; creates a sharp contrast between local safety and global faith.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: God is the source of an 'incorruptible' legacy.

verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Introducing 'suffering' as a mandatory part of the inheritance package.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Fits the lectionary focus on Romans 8 and the adoption of sons.

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is dominated by the ECONOMIC and RELATIONAL domains, specifically the concept of 'Inheritance.' It successfully bridges the gap between the hearers' socio-economic status and the biblical text by using the source domain of wealth to explain the target domain of spiritual security.

revitalisatie_suggesties.huidige_status: Can feel abstract or purely legalistic.
revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Deepen the 'suffering' aspect of the source domain.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: Describe the 'legal fees' or 'courtroom battles' of the martyrs.

coherentie_verbeteringen.incoherentie: The shift to 'Building on a Rock'
coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Stick to the inheritance language by calling Christ the 'Estate' or the 'Trust' that cannot be moved.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: Inheritance usually requires the death of the father.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Explicitly link the 'inheritance' to the death of Jesus to ground the economic metaphor in the Atonement.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: Given the Bicentennial context, mapping the Kingdom of God to a 'New Country' would resonate with the political themes mentioned.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in using the congregation's specific cultural and economic 'schema' to explain a complex Pauline concept.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: CMT focuses on how 'inheritance' structures the hearer's logic of risk, not just the beauty of the word.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Focuses on cognitive mapping rather than the four learning styles (though it hits 'concrete experience' well).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: Reveals that the preacher is using the 'Security' entailment of wealth to drive the 'Risk' behavior of the believer.

volledige_metafoor_lijst: Moths and rust do not corrupt
appendices.notities: Sermon delivered in a wealthy context (Greenwich, CT), making the economic metaphors particularly high-stakes.
